please use try-with-resources to simplify the try/catch pattern:
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/tryResourceClose.html
done
fix code style.
done
Good point 👍  Done

it seems you are using isDeleteCollections for not only deleting collections but also for creating collection?
is that right? the config seems to be overloaded.
during deleteCollections workload we don't want to create db/collection/data . createClient method during initialization will create client/db/container/data.
discussed offline

it seems you are using deleteCollections for not only deleting collections but also for creating collection?
is that right? the config seems to be overloaded.
during deleteCollections workload we don't want to create db/collection/data . createClient method during initialization will create client/db/container/data.

two comments:

awesome, it is a good idea to automatically create and delete the collection, this will be useful for non multi client scenarios as well. Could you please extend to the non multi client scenario as well.
the description of the parameter and its name doesn't reflect what this is doing (how about autoContainerCreationEnabled
also we should change throughputForMultiClient to throughput to make it applicable to non multi client scenario as well.
discussed offline , new PR on benchmark will use autoCreateColection for all work flow
meterRegistry is a static setting, why do we need to set it "inside" the for loop? shouldn't this be outside?
done
meterRegistry is a static setting, why do we need to set it "inside" the for loop? shouldn't this be outside?
done

code style: you have multiple spaces String  throughputForMultiClientValue -> String throughputForMultiClientValue
code style: space after comma
this will print the key as well. can we just print the endpoint. ideally we should not log key anywhere in the log.

ditto. we should not log the key

if we are creating the collection, we should allow the throughput to be configurable similar to collectionId and databaseId.
it meant to be , had created configuration property for it .It was missed during usage , fixed it .
